summary: In this context, acetone and toluene are both included as components of a volatile organic compound (VOC) mixture used in a biotrickling filter (BTF) study aimed at treating emissions from pharmaceutical industries. Acetone represents ketones, while toluene represents aromatic compounds, highlighting their roles in the broader category of VOCs. However, the context does not delve into their specific interactions or comparative significance beyond their classification as part of the mixture.
